if there are any questions

2088.text:
HJ: I think one of the
things that I've just

2091.text:
had that Davin has
said, which I think

2093.text:
is a really great
tip, is when you've

2095.text:
got the online tutorials, is to
head into the room a little bit

2098.text:
beforehand to make sure you're
all set up, because sometimes

2101.text:
something goes wrong or it takes
a little longer than you think.

2104.text:
I found that on
my first tutorial.

2106.text:
I went in on the time because
it was going to start at midday,

2109.text:
and then I found out it
took about 15 minutes

2112.text:
So I like that tip
from Davin reminding

2113.text:
us to get in there a bit early
to make sure we're all set up.

2116.text:
And then you can say hi
to everyone as well when--

2119.text:
just before it starts
and have a little chat

2122.text:
ANNIE: A few people have
said Dragon Dictation is

2124.text:
a really good app, where you
talk and it types for you,

2128.text:
which is really good if you want
to take notes really quickly.

2131.text:
Or anyone that I
know, I'm dyslexic.

2133.text:
So I sometimes use that,
which really helps me

2135.text:
to kind of focus on what
I want to write down,

2137.text:
because my thought process
can kind of go off if I'm

2140.text: writing notes at the same time.

2142.text:
So if anyone wants to use that
that's a really good one to do.

2146.text:
HJ: But we also--
in that session,

2148.text:
we had a little talk
about online tutorials

2152.text:
And it was really
cutting it close when

2154.text: we were looking at that widget.

2155.text: It was kind of evenly split.

2158.text:
But people like both
for different reasons.

2160.text:
I think that both of them
have pros and cons for people.

2162.text:
So people like the convenience
of online tutorials.

2165.text: You can just be their at home.

2166.text:
A lot of people
like face-to-face

2169.text:
I really enjoy face-to-face
tutorials for that.

2171.text:
ANNIE: Yeah, and bouncing
off of the students

2173.text:
and seeing what they have to
say, and that sort of thing.

2175.text: It is very helpful, isn't it?

2177.text:
HJ: And then I think
someone-- ah, there you go.

2180.text:
Samantha says she was a
bit nervous about going

2184.text: But I was for my first one too.

2186.text:
But I found that everyone's
not there to say, you know,

2188.text:
how brilliant that they are
doing at their assignments.

2191.text:
Everyone's like, nervous
about the same things,

2194.text:
and they have similar
questions to you.

2196.text:
So it's really good
just to go along,

2198.text:
and you'll find you'll fit
in quite well actually.

2202.text:

some more stuff come in.

2204.text:
You've sent us loads
of great stuff.

2207.text:
So we've had-- was it Andrew--
sent in their workspace, which

2211.text:
is putting me to shame because
this desk is-- I really do try

2218.text:

all right, HJ.

2221.text:
I can see it coming
over the top.

2223.text: HJ: It doesn't happen, does it?

2225.text: to have to prove it now, HJ.

about that officially

2233.text:
that she's eating at the

2237.text:

it's about that lunchtime.

my lunch today.

brought my lunch.

2246.text:
